name: hawkweed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
one of many different wild plants with yellow or orange flowers that can cause serious problems in areas where they do not grow naturally: Hawkweed is already rampant in parts of the wildlife refuge. Many hawkweeds reproduce from fruits formed without fertilization having occurred.
More examplesFewer examplesIf orange hawkweed overruns wildlife forage there's nothing for the moose to eat.We walked through short grass where yellow hawkweed grew in profusion.The Snowdonia hawkweed was rediscovered in North Wales in 2002, 35 years after it was presumed extinct.
